summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of East Spring Street, from Twenty-fifth Avenue to Thirty-second Avenue; Twenty-sixth Avenue, from the south line of Buckius' Addition to the City of Seattle to East Union Street; Twenty-seventh Avenue, from the south line of Buckius' Addition to the City of Seattle to East Union Street; Twenty-eighth Avenue, from East Cherry Street to East Union Street; Twenty-ninth Avenue, from East Cherry Street to East Union Street, all in the City of Seattle by constructing concrete sidewalks, with all necessary curbs, gutters and crosswalks, catch basins, and other appurtenances, accordance with Resolution No. 54, of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
